title: How to Make Marshmallow Bunnies

methods.name: Assembling Bunnies with Store Bought Marshmallows

steps.headline: Make the ears.
steps.description: To start, take a pair of scissors. Use this to cut your marshmallows cross wise. Cut them into four even pieces. These should resemble diamond shapes, which you will use for bunny ears.

steps.headline: Make the legs.
steps.description: Cut about half inch pieces from the flat ends of larger marshmallows. Cut these ends into two semi-circles. These will be attached as legs.

steps.headline: Melt the white candy melts.
steps.description: Place your white candy melts in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave them on high for one minute and then stir. Continue to microwave the candy melts for 30 second intervals, stirring in between, until your candy melts are melted into an even paste.

steps.headline: Add sprinkles.
steps.description: Place your pink sugar in a small bowl. Press the sticky sides of your bunny ears into the sprinkles. This will coat them with pink.

steps.headline: Make the bunny's body.
steps.description: Connect two whole marshmallows by coating the flat side of one with melted candy melts. Press the round side of the other marshmallow onto the flat side of the other. The marshmallow connected at the round side is the head. The other marshmallow is the body.

steps.headline: Add the ears and tail.
steps.description: Add the ears to either side of your bunny's head using candy melts as glue. Add the feet to either side of the bunny's body, securing them with candy melts. When you're done, you should have a cute marshmallow bunny.

steps.headline: Beat the sugar and water.
steps.description: Pour your cold water in a mixing bowl. Then, add the sugar. Use an electric mixer to beat the sugar and water on a high speed until everything's evenly mixed.

steps.headline: Dissolve your gelatin.
steps.description: Add your gelatin to the hot water. Set it aside until it dissolves completely.The precise amount of time it takes gelatin to dissolve depends on the type you bought. Consult your package.

steps.headline: Add the gelatin to the sugar.
steps.description: Once the gelatin is dissolved, add the gelatin to the sugar/water mixture. Beat everything together using an electronic mixture until you have a thick, white mixture.

steps.headline: Pour into rabbit moulds.
steps.description: You can buy rabbit moulds for baked goods online or at a department store. Spray the mould with non cook spray. Then, pour your gelatin into the moulds.

steps.headline: Refrigerate.
steps.description: Put the mould into the refrigerator. Do not remove it until everything sets and you have solid marshmallows. Times will vary depending on the precise heat of your refrigerator.If you want, use red or black food coloring to add eyes and whiskers after your marshmallows set.

steps.headline: Mix the water and gelatin.
steps.description: In a stand mixer, pour 1/3 of your water into a bowl. Sprinkle the gelatin on top of the water. Set this aside for 10 minutes. During this time, the gelatin will soften.

steps.headline: Heat the water, sugar, corn syrup, and salt.
steps.description: In a saucepan, mix another 1/3 cup of your water with your sugar, corn syrup, and salt. Heat the ingredients over medium high heat. Keep a thermometer in the mixture as it heats. Keep heating it until it reaches 240 °F (116 °C). Do not stir the mixture while it cooks.When the mixture reaches 240 degrees, use a damp pastry brush to wipe down the sides of the pan to remove any sugar crystals.

steps.headline: Add the syrup mixture to the gelatin.
steps.description: Set your mixture to the lowest speed setting. As the gelatin and water begin to mix, very slowly pour in the heated sugar and corn syrup mixture.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla.
steps.description: Add your vanilla. As you do this, turn your mixer to medium-high speed. Mix everything together for eight minutes. When your mixture is done, it should be sticky, thick, and white. It should resemble melted marshmallows.

steps.headline: Spread the ingredients out over a pan.
steps.description: Grease a 9 by 13 inch pan and spread your ingredients over it. Use a lightly oiled spatula to transfer the mixture to the pan. Then, use your hands to spread this into an even layer over the entire pan.

steps.headline: Set aside for an hour.
steps.description: Give the mixture about an hour to harden. When it's done, it should be roughly the same texture as store bought marshmallows. If your mixture is not the right texture after an hour, let it sit for a little longer.

steps.headline: Cut the marshmallow into rabbits.
steps.description: Remove the sheet of marshmallow from the pan using a spatula. Set it on a piece of parchment paper. Use a bunny cookie cutter to cut the marshmallow into bunny shapes.

steps.headline: Make your chocolate covering.
steps.description: Melt 14 ounces of your chocolate in a microwave at 30 second increments. Then, add the remaining two ounces of chocolate and the shortening. Mix everything together with a spoon until you have an even mixture.

steps.headline: Coat the rabbits in the chocolate.
steps.description: Dip your rabbits in the chocolate mixture one at a time using a tong or fork. Get all sides completely coated in chocolate. Then, set your rabbits aside to cool for an hour before serving.

text: Assembling Bunnies with Store Bought Marshmallows Make the ears. To start, take a pair of scissors. Use this to cut your marshmallows cross wise. Cut them into four even pieces. These should resemble diamond shapes, which you will use for bunny ears. Make the legs. Cut about half inch pieces from the flat ends of larger marshmallows. Cut these ends into two semi-circles. These will be attached as legs. Melt the white candy melts. Place your white candy melts in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave them on high for one minute and then stir. Continue to microwave the candy melts for 30 second intervals, stirring in between, until your candy melts are melted into an even paste. Add sprinkles. Place your pink sugar in a small bowl. Press the sticky sides of your bunny ears into the sprinkles. This will coat them with pink. Make the bunny's body. Connect two whole marshmallows by coating the flat side of one with melted candy melts. Press the round side of the other marshmallow onto the flat side of the other. The marshmallow connected at the round side is the head. The other marshmallow is the body. Add the ears and tail. Add the ears to either side of your bunny's head using candy melts as glue. Add the feet to either side of the bunny's body, securing them with candy melts. When you're done, you should have a cute marshmallow bunny. Making Your Own Marshmallows Beat the sugar and water. Pour your cold water in a mixing bowl. Then, add the sugar. Use an electric mixer to beat the sugar and water on a high speed until everything's evenly mixed. Dissolve your gelatin. Add your gelatin to the hot water. Set it aside until it dissolves completely.The precise amount of time it takes gelatin to dissolve depends on the type you bought. Consult your package. Add the gelatin to the sugar. Once the gelatin is dissolved, add the gelatin to the sugar/water mixture. Beat everything together using an electronic mixture until you have a thick, white mixture. Pour into rabbit moulds. You can buy rabbit moulds for baked goods online or at a department store. Spray the mould with non cook spray. Then, pour your gelatin into the moulds. Refrigerate. Put the mould into the refrigerator. Do not remove it until everything sets and you have solid marshmallows. Times will vary depending on the precise heat of your refrigerator.If you want, use red or black food coloring to add eyes and whiskers after your marshmallows set. Making Chocolate Marshmallow Bunnies Mix the water and gelatin. In a stand mixer, pour 1/3 of your water into a bowl. Sprinkle the gelatin on top of the water. Set this aside for 10 minutes. During this time, the gelatin will soften. Heat the water, sugar, corn syrup, and salt. In a saucepan, mix another 1/3 cup of your water with your sugar, corn syrup, and salt. Heat the ingredients over medium high heat. Keep a thermometer in the mixture as it heats. Keep heating it until it reaches 240 °F (116 °C). Do not stir the mixture while it cooks.When the mixture reaches 240 degrees, use a damp pastry brush to wipe down the sides of the pan to remove any sugar crystals. Add the syrup mixture to the gelatin. Set your mixture to the lowest speed setting. As the gelatin and water begin to mix, very slowly pour in the heated sugar and corn syrup mixture. Add the vanilla. Add your vanilla. As you do this, turn your mixer to medium-high speed. Mix everything together for eight minutes. When your mixture is done, it should be sticky, thick, and white. It should resemble melted marshmallows. Spread the ingredients out over a pan. Grease a 9 by 13 inch pan and spread your ingredients over it. Use a lightly oiled spatula to transfer the mixture to the pan. Then, use your hands to spread this into an even layer over the entire pan. Set aside for an hour. Give the mixture about an hour to harden. When it's done, it should be roughly the same texture as store bought marshmallows. If your mixture is not the right texture after an hour, let it sit for a little longer. Cut the marshmallow into rabbits. Remove the sheet of marshmallow from the pan using a spatula. Set it on a piece of parchment paper. Use a bunny cookie cutter to cut the marshmallow into bunny shapes. Make your chocolate covering. Melt 14 ounces of your chocolate in a microwave at 30 second increments. Then, add the remaining two ounces of chocolate and the shortening. Mix everything together with a spoon until you have an even mixture. Coat the rabbits in the chocolate. Dip your rabbits in the chocolate mixture one at a time using a tong or fork. Get all sides completely coated in chocolate. Then, set your rabbits aside to cool for an hour before serving.
